name: All new Translate value should be at dd/mm/yyyy (PeopleSoft)
description:
This quality rule reports all Field Translate values with an effective date not equal to parameter 'Format is dd/mm/yyyy'.
This parameter is of type character, and it can be changed at will.
Default value is 01/01/1900.
output:
This report lists all the PeopleSoft Field translate values with effective date not aligned with the parameter value.
It provides the following information: 
- PeopleSoft Field translate value full name.
rationale: To ensure that added Translate values are used in place of the standard value, choose an effective date greater than 01/01/1900.
remediation:
To change an existing translate value, select the value and click Change or double-click the value. The system displays the Change Translate Table dialog box, in which you can make the necessary changes. 
To take into account this type of change, you create a second active entry for the same translate value, effective from date entered as dd/mm/yyyy, onwards.
The first value is valid in the time range between the effective dates of January 1, 1990, date entered dd/mm/yyyy.
total: Number of PeopleSoft Field translate values (MODIFIED)
alternativeName: All new Translate value should be at dd/mm/yyyy (PeopleSoft)
